networking

Class SBServer.ClientConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • networking.SBServer.ClientConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    SBServer

    private class SBServer.ClientConnector
extends java.lang.Thread
    A SBServer.ClientConnector is a user connection thread. It handles the communication between a user and the server. It is a inner class of server because it has to share states with the server.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      • run

        public void run()
        A new SBServer.ClientConnector is spawned for every connection accepted by the server. It first validates user login, then put user into server's online user list. It listens to user messages and call response(SBMessage) to parse user message and make response.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
